cities.name: Berlin
cities.description: Germany's vibrant capital with extensive parks, cafés, and dog-friendly culture
dogRules: 🟢 Dogs allowed off-leash in designated areas (Hundeauslaufgebiete)
� Dog tax (Hundesteuer) €120/year - register at local Bürgeramt
� Dogs ride free on BVG (U-Bahn, S-Bahn, buses) without muzzle
🔴 Must be on leash in public spaces, parks, and on transport
🧹 Always carry poo bags - fines up to €35 for not cleaning
🏞️ Off-leash areas: Tempelhofer Feld, Grunewald Forest, Volkspark
🐕 Dangerous breeds require special permit and muzzle in public

cities.name: Barcelona
cities.description: Mediterranean coastal city with dog-friendly beaches, parks, and outdoor culture
dogRules: 🟢 Dogs welcome in most outdoor cafés and terraces
📝 Microchip mandatory - register at local district office
🔴 Banned from beaches May 1 - Sept 30 (4 dog beaches exempt)
� Small dogs in carriers on TMB Metro - larger dogs not allowed
🧹 Must clean waste - fines from €300 to €750
🏖️ Dog beaches: Platja de Llevant, Zona de Banys Forum
⏰ Some parks allow off-leash 22:00-08:00 (check signs)

cities.name: Paris
cities.description: The City of Light welcomes dogs in cafés, parks, and along the Seine
dogRules: 🟢 Dogs welcome in most cafés - very dog-friendly city
🔴 Banned from Luxembourg Garden, Tuileries, and children's areas
📝 Vaccination certificate and ID tag required by law
🚇 Small dogs in carriers free on RATP Metro - large dogs muzzled
🧹 Must clean waste - fines from €68 to €450
🏞️ Bois de Boulogne & Bois de Vincennes off-leash areas
⚠️ Category 1 & 2 breeds must wear muzzle and be on leash

cities.name: Rome
cities.description: Ancient city with historic parks, piazzas, and dog-friendly trattorias
dogRules: 🟢 Dogs welcome at most restaurant outdoor seating areas
� Microchip and health booklet (passaporto) mandatory
�🔴 Banned from Colosseum, Forum, Vatican, and archaeological sites
� Dogs on ATAC Metro/buses must be muzzled or in carrier
🧹 Must clean waste - fines from €50 to €500
🏞️ Villa Pamphilj, Villa Ada, Villa Borghese off-leash areas
🏖️ Most beaches ban dogs May-September (check local rules)

cities.name: Vienna
cities.description: Imperial city with elegant cafés, parks, and dog-friendly culture
dogRules: 🟢 Very dog-friendly - dogs welcome in cafés and restaurants
� Dog tax (Hundeabgabe) €72/year - register at MA 60
� Dogs free on Wiener Linien if muzzled or small in carrier
� Must be on leash in city center and on public transport
🧹 Must clean waste - fines up to €36
🏞️ Prater main area and Donauinsel large off-leash zones
☕ Traditional Viennese cafés often welcome well-behaved dogs

cities.name: Amsterdam
cities.description: Canal city with dog-friendly cafés, parks, and cycling culture
dogRules: 🟢 One of Europe's most dog-friendly cities - welcome everywhere
� Microchip and registration required at local municipality
� Dogs need ticket on GVB (€3.20 day pass) - not in carriers
🔴 Must be on leash in Vondelpark, city center, and on transport
🧹 Must clean waste - fines up to €140
🏖️ Dog beaches: Blijburg, Zandvoort, and Kennemer beach
🚴 Dutch love dogs in bike baskets - ensure dog is secure!

cities.name: New York
cities.description: The Big Apple with Central Park, dog-friendly cafés, and urban dog culture
dogRules: 🟢 Dogs welcome at most outdoor restaurant seating areas
� NYC dog license required - $8.50/year (spayed/neutered)
�🔴 Must be on leash max 6 ft except in designated dog runs
🧹 Scoop the poop law strictly enforced - fines up to $250
🚇 Dogs on MTA subway only in carriers that fit on lap
🏞️ 70+ official dog runs including Central Park, Prospect Park
⏰ Off-leash hours in parks: 9PM-9AM (check park rules)

cities.name: Los Angeles
cities.description: Sunny California city with beaches, hiking trails, and pet-friendly culture
dogRules: 🟢 Very dog-friendly - welcome at most outdoor dining areas
� LA County license $20/year (altered) or $60/year (unaltered)
� Must be on leash in public except designated dog parks
🧹 Scoop waste or face fines up to $500
🏖️ Dog beaches: Leo Carrillo, Rosie's (Long Beach), Huntington
🚗 NEVER leave dog in car - temperatures kill - $500 fine
🏞️ 100+ dog parks: Runyon Canyon, Laurel Canyon, Silverlake

cities.name: Sydney
cities.description: Harbour city with dog-friendly beaches, coastal walks, and outdoor lifestyle
dogRules: 🟢 Many parks have off-leash areas during designated hours
📝 Registration and microchip mandatory - register with council
💰 Annual registration: $52 (desexed) to $267 (entire dog)
🔴 Must be on leash in public streets and on transport
🧹 Scoop waste - fines up to $880
🏖️ Dog beaches: Rose Bay, Rowland Reserve (off-peak hours)
⏰ Off-leash times vary by park - check council signage

cities.name: Melbourne
cities.description: Cultural capital with laneway cafés, parks, and dog-friendly venues
dogRules: 🟢 One of Australia's most dog-friendly cities!
Registration and microchip required with local council
💰 Annual fee: $52 (desexed) to $267 (entire) - varies by council
🔴 On-leash in streets, shopping areas, and public transport
🧹 Scoop waste - fines from $181 to $466
🏖️ St Kilda Dog Beach open year-round - very popular!
🚇 Small dogs in carriers on trams/trains - larger dogs restricted

cities.name: Buenos Aires
cities.description: Vibrant capital with parks, plazas, and dog-loving culture
dogRules: 🟢 Extremely dog-friendly culture - dogs welcome everywhere!
🔴 Leash law exists but enforcement is very relaxed
📝 Registration available but not strictly enforced
🧹 Please clean up waste in parks and public spaces
🏞️ Palermo parks (Bosques, 3 de Febrero) full of dogs
🍽️ Almost all cafés and restaurants welcome dogs
🚇 Dogs on Subte Line D outside peak hours (check rules)

cities.name: Córdoba
cities.description: University city surrounded by mountains and natural parks
dogRules: 🟢 Relaxed, dog-friendly atmosphere in public spaces
🔴 Leash recommended in city center but loosely enforced
📝 Municipal dog registration available at local offices
🧹 Please clean up waste in parks and public areas
🏞️ Parque Sarmiento has popular dog areas
🍽️ Nueva Córdoba cafés very welcoming to dogs
🏔️ Sierras trails perfect for hiking with dogs

cities.name: Tokyo
cities.description: Modern metropolis with pet cafés, dog parks, and pet-friendly culture
dogRules: 🟢 Growing pet café culture - many dog-friendly spots
📝 Registration required within 30 days - ¥3,000/year (~$20)
� Must be on leash in all public spaces - strictly enforced
🧹 Always clean up waste - carry poo bags essential
🚇 Dogs only on trains/subways in carriers or bags - no exceptions
🏞️ Dog runs: Yoyogi Park, Komazawa Park, Kinuta Park
🐕 Pet-friendly accommodations and cafés growing in popularity

metadata.notes: New cities have placeCount: 0 until places are added via admin or scraping

trails.name: Trails & Treks
trails.description: Hiking trails and scenic walking routes
